column1: *'''Subject:''' Tolkien discusses ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''
{{Blockquote|thanking the recipient for his letter (“it is not often that people write to an author… it is
column3: a very pleasant sort of letter to get…”)
column4: discussing The Hobbit in some detail
column6: destruction of publisher’s stock in the Blitz
column8: discussion of Runes on the book's dust-jacket and mentioning “the sequel
column9: if that is ever printed in these paperless days”. Discussing future plans at greater length
column10: Tolkien notes that “the dwarf and goblin wars belong to a little known part of the history
column11: which I have not studied in detail yet” and then states “I have nearly finished another book… It is however very long… You remember the references to the Necromancer and his stronghold in Southern Mirkwood
column12: and to the White Council? Well
column13: Bilbo’s affairs there just touched on the most important of all matters… So the next book explains it
column14: and a very dark business it is…” Tolkien then provides a list of elements of The Lord of the Rings: “You will meet the perennial Gandalf again… Bilbo and many other hobbits of Took descent
column15: and also one Sam Gamgee; Tom Bombadil… Trotter the Ranger; Ents (very strange creatures); Elrond
column17: and others; and visit the Mines of Moria
column18: the elf-lands of Lothlórien; the Riders of Rohan; the Fortress of Minas Tirith; and come to the final overthrow of the Dark Tower. Or I hope so. And supposing you want to.” Tolkien finishes with a typical reference to his academic responsibilities ("I have now myself to put aside the more interesting (and I think more important) tracts of Ancient History for Examinations... It would comfort the 'examinees' a good deal
column20: if they realized that the Examiners
column22: suffer at least as much in what we must suppose to be a good cause... as they do. Indeed
column24: for the torture of the Examiners is more prolonged...") <ref name=Sothebys>{{webcite|articleurl=http://www.sothebys.com/en/auctions/ecatalogue/2012/english-literature-history-l12408/lot.186.html|articlename=Lot 186
